meanings.definition: To make something outdated or no longer current.
meanings.sent1: Using old technology can quickly outdate your devices.
meanings.sent2: Technology tends to outdate quickly in today's fast-paced world.
meanings.sent3: It would be funny if a time traveler accidentally outdates all the modern gadgets.
meanings.sent4: The rapid advancements in technology can outdate even the most recent innovations.
meanings.sent5: The new software update will outdate the current version in no time.

meanings.definition: To become outdated or no longer current.
meanings.sent1: If you don't keep up with the latest trends, you may outdate yourself.
meanings.sent2: Fashion trends can easily outdate within a season.
meanings.sent3: It's like watching a movie from the '80s and realizing how much it has outdated over the years.
meanings.sent4: Her style choices quickly outdate, making her wardrobe seem old-fashioned.
meanings.sent5: The once popular app started to outdate as newer, more innovative ones emerged.
